title: HPI Spencer
content: Stephanie Humphrey, a right-hand dominant horticulturalist, fell on 6/21/25, sustaining left wrist pain. Urgent care X-rays showed no fractures, diagnosed as a sprain. Pain worsened in Massachusetts due to humidity.
Amit Jaini, a left-hand dominant music manager, injured his right small finger playing basketball on 8/2/25. Immediate pain and swelling led to X-rays revealing a proximal phalanx fracture.
David Schechter, a right-hand dominant pain medicine doctor, experienced right wrist pain since early 2024 without trauma. Pain worsens with supination and flexion.
instruction: Summarize HPI with onset, duration, location, severity, mechanism, treatments, and progression.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Left wrist: mild tendon inflammation over ECU tendon, pain with pro-supination.
Right small finger: malrotation, shortening, limited motion.
Right wrist: mild tendinopathy at ECU tendon.
instruction: Extract physical exam findings related to musculoskeletal.

title: Imaging Results
content: Left wrist X-rays normal.
Right small finger X-rays show proximal phalanx fracture.
Right wrist X-rays normal with mild joint space narrowing at thumb MCP.

title: Assessment
content:
- Left ECU tendonitis
- Left ulnar-sided wrist pain
- Right small finger proximal phalanx fracture
- Right wrist pain with mild tendinopathy

title: Plan
content:
- Recommend RE full
- Trial of hand therapy
- MRI for further evaluation
- Follow-up after MRI.
- Closed reduction and percutaneous pinning tomorrow.
- Plan pending Dr. De La George's input.
